txt.en: 'This is worse than we could have ever imagined. Be ready for anything!'
'Do not lose your nerve!'
'Onwards! We must find Amdir!'
'It is a day both dreary and joyous. It grieves me that we were forced to slay Amdir, but a relief that he should now know peace.\n\n'I will lead you back to Strider. I will return to my camp.'

'Can you feel the chill in the air? It is no natural cold, but the chill of fear, of evil. I doubt not that Amdir is here, but there is a greater evil as well.

'We should split our strength. For the good of Middle-earth, none can be allowed to escape. Lenglinn and I will look for another way inside, while you and Torthann search for Amdir.

'We must be quick now, before the evil bursts forth from here and threatens all of Bree-land.'
'The very air seems polluted by this night's business. We should tarry here no longer.'
'Come with me. It is time to deal with Amdir and these brigands. If Amdir escapes, it could spell doom for Middle-earth.'
'Brigands! Get them!'
'Down there, in the southern corner of the camp... the source of the Blackwolds' fear is there! Come!'
Torthann has been defeated. You have failed

'Who was that dwarf and what power has he to command wights? That the Blackwolds were in terror of that creature is certain, but I still sense something greater still in these ruins.\n\n'And where is Amdir? Perhaps beyond that gate.'
Torthann has been defeated. You have failed
'First, you must fully become one of us.  Your transition begins now!'
Torthann has been defeated. You have failed
'Stop your crying, men! The Blackwolds don't shy from battle!'
'Wait! Someone is coming. Let us see who it is!'
'I fear that foul dwarf is not the end of the evil here.'
Strider has asked you to help him end Amdir's murderous rampage once and for all.
'The greatest evils may be behind this gate. Rest now, for we will need all our strength ahead!'
'I have other business to deal with... my servant shall deal with you!'
'You have joined our ranks and will now wear the robes of your brethren.'
'And rise as one of the Cargûl, Foresworn... what is this?'
'The Rangers approach with fire!  We flee now!'
'You do not belong here, Nazgûl!'
'In the name of the Dúnedain!'
'Back, foul beasts!'
'Do not let them escape!'
'My Lords! The Rangers approach with fire!'
'Let us go! We must find Amdir!'
Help Torthann enter the Blackwold camp
'Now, Amdir! Take on the robes of the Cargûl -- the Foresworn!'
Talk to Torthann
'Let me see about this gate.'
Defend Torthann as he searches for Amdir
Discover what is causing the brigands' fear
Speak with Torthann
'If you need rest, then now is the time to steel your nerve!'
Defend Torthann as he searches for the evil in the brigands' camp
Speak with Torthann
'Please leave me alone! I don't know where [placeholder] is!'
Defend Torthann as he searches for Amdir
'What do you want with me! I don't know anything!'
'What was that thing?'
'You will not win this day!'
Speak with Torthann
'I am sorry, Amdir... be at peace....'
'You are too late! I am Cargûl! I serve the Great Eye!'
'Ah! I have found them after all. You are relieved of your obligations, Blackwold.'
'Keep it away from me!'
Strider and his kinsmen, Torthann and Lenglinn, have led you to the outskirts of the brigand camp. Strider beckons to you.
Strider told you to speak with Torthann when you are ready to begin your search for Amdir. Strider and Lenglinn will find a back way in.
'You shall not interfere!'
'Yes, sir.'
Torthann sensed the source of the brigands' fear in the southern corner of the camp. You should investigate.
'Amdir is now a servant of the Great Eye!'
'It is time for us to act.'
Torthann is not convinced that the evil ends with the wight and thinks that Amdir is somewhere near by. Perhaps there is more to the camp.
'Torthann, take [placeholder] with you and head to the main gate.'
Torthann beckons to you.
'Lenglinn and I shall look for another entrance and press the attack from there.'
'Good. Lenglinn, let us go.'
'The fools are too late. Amdir's change is nearly complete!'
'Come, brethren, we must leave. Now is not the time for such a fight.'
'We leave Amdir and these fools in your care, Éogan!'
'I yearn to put an end to these brigands, but you should speak to Strider first. He is directing our efforts.'
'What were those things? That dwarf has gone mad!'
'Yes, my lord!'
'There, there now. There's no need for concern... yet.'
'Are we safe here, Aragorn?'
'Why are you so worried, Blackwold?'
'Amdir could be anywhere. What makes you so sure it's here?'
'Did you think service to Angmar came without a cost?'
'Now, to deal with you, Ranger!'
'Come friend, this is not the end of our business here!'
'Amdir's terror must end now!'
'No, no, no! Stay away!'
'The Nazgûl! We must tread carefully.'
Instance: Unravelling the Thread
